statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Bucknell 77, Lafayette 75
article.story: LEWISBURG, Pa. (AP) -- Stephen Tyree scored on a driving layup with 2.9 seconds left in overtime and Bucknell snapped a three-game losing streak with a 77-75 win over Lafayette on Wednesday night. Bison freshman Darryl Shazier forced overtime with a 3-pointer with 13 seconds left in regulation to tie the game at 67. The Leopards had two shots in the final seconds, but both jumpers were off the mark. Andrew Brown led the Leopards with 17 points Lafayette (14-12 overall, 5-6 Patriot League) took a 75-73 lead on two free throws by Bilal Abdullah with 1:01 left in overtime. Bucknell (11-15, 6-6) tied it on two free throws by John Griffin with 52 seconds remaining. After the Leopards were called for a shot-clock violation with 15 seconds showing, the Bison called timeout to set up the final play for Tyree, who got a step on Abdullah while driving the right side of the lane. Abdullah fell back and Tyree took advantage by laying it over the rim. Lafayette got the ball to half court and called a time-out. Matt Betley's inbound pass to Abdullah didn't connect and time expired. The Bison led by 12 points, 33-21, at halftime and 42-30 at the 14:35 mark of the second half before the Leopards put together a 24-6 run to take a 54-48 lead on a free throw by Michael Gruner at the 7:38 mark.
